clinical_study.brief_title: Project Prepared: Risks, Roles and Relationships
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Intervention Study to Prepare Early Adolescents for Middle Adolescence, Specifically Focusing on Improving Sexual Health Outcomes

lead_sponsor.agency: Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Inc.

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

clinical_study.source: Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: Project Prepared is a theoretically based, comprehensive, intensive group intervention that is designed to prepare early adolescents for middle adolescence and its challenges. It emphasizes skills in avoiding risky sexual situations, and provides medically accurate information about sexual development, sexually transmitted infections and pregnancy. Effectiveness is measured by using a randomized control trial design and tracking differences in cognitive factors (HIV/STI (Sexually Transmitted Infections) knowledge, sexual self-efficacy; intention to use a condom); relationship factors (immature romantic beliefs, relationship self-efficacy), gender norms (macho man, powerless female), and resilience.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Intentions to engage in safer sex behavior at 6 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Intentions to engage in safer sex behavior at 1 year
primary_outcome.description: measuring change from baseline to 1 year (as compared to control group)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive Factors at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: measuring change in HIV/STI knowledge, condom outcome and efficacy expectancies, sexual self-efficacy from baseline to 6 months (compared to control group)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cognitive Factors at 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: measuring changes in HIV/STI knowledge, condom outcome and efficacy expectancies, sexual self-efficacy from baseline to 1 year (as compared to control group)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 12-14 yrs old
- lives in the Bronx, NY at Baseline
- Has been seen at some point in one of the Montefiore Medical Center community health clinics.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to independently complete the questionnaire/training due to sensory, cognitive or motor disabilities.
- Reading ability NOT at 5th grade on the reading subtest of the Wide-range Achievement Test.
